text: Banja Stijena, also Banj Stijena, Ban Stijena (referring to medieval title), or Mračna Pećina (), as locally known, is a cave in Bosnia and Herzegovina located in the canyon of the river Prača. The cave has an extensive channel system about 2,000 meters long. It is rich in various types of cave features. It was first mentioned in the early 20th century when constructing a railway through the canyon. Access to the cave was mined during the Bosnian War. Banja Stijena cave is a special geological reserve. == References == == External links == Category:Coordinates on Wikidata Category:Rogatica Category:Caves of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Karst caves of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Karst formation of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Subterranean rivers of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Underground lakes of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Drina basin Category:Karst springs of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Glasinac plateau
title: Banja Stijena
